bullet_summary: “It’s clear to me that you engaged in a premeditated, calculated plot to take a human life,” Cannon said
District Judge Aileen Cannon sentenced Ryan Routh on Wednesday to life in prison for trying to assassinate Donald Trump when he was running for president in 2024, The Associated Press reported

items.title: Inside the courtroom as Ryan Routh sentenced to life for Trump assassination attempt
items.standfirst: Ryan Routh received a life sentence Wednesday for his 2024 assassination attempt on Donald Trump. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.
items.content: Ryan Routh received a life sentence Wednesday for his 2024 assassination attempt on Donald Trump. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.

items.title: Man gets life in prison for trying to assassinate Trump at a Florida golf course
items.standfirst: U.S. District Judge Aileen Cannon pronounced Ryan Routh's fate in the same Fort Pierce courtroom that erupted into chaos in September when he tried to stab himself shortly after jurors found him guilty on all counts.
items.content: U.S. District Judge Aileen Cannon pronounced Ryan Routh's fate in the same Fort Pierce courtroom that erupted into chaos in September when he tried to stab himself shortly after jurors found him guilty on all counts.

items.title: Man who tried to assassinate Trump in Florida sentenced to life in prison
items.standfirst: Ryan Routh, who tried to kill president in 2024, also receives a consecutive seven-year sentence for gun convictionA man convicted of trying to assassinate Donald Trump on a Florida golf course in 2024 was sentenced on Wednesday to life in prison. US district judge Aileen Cannon pronounced Ryan Routh’s fate in the same Fort Pierce courtroom that erupted into chaos in September when he tried to stab himself shortly after jurors found him guilty on all counts.“It’s clear to me that you engaged in a premeditated, calculated plot to take a human life,” Cannon said. Continue reading...
items.content: Ryan Routh, who tried to kill president in 2024, also receives a consecutive seven-year sentence for gun convictionA man convicted of trying to assassinate Donald Trump on a Florida golf course in 2024 was sentenced on Wednesday to life in prison. US district judge Aileen Cannon pronounced Ryan Routh’s fate in the same Fort Pierce courtroom that erupted into chaos in September when he tried to stab himself shortly after jurors found him guilty on all counts.“It’s clear to me that you engaged in a premeditated, calculated plot to take a human life,” Cannon said. Continue reading...

items.title: White House border czar says 700 federal agents will leave Minnesota
items.standfirst: Departure marks large drop in agents on the ground but still leaves about 2,000 there, far above typical levels for stateUS politics live – latest updatesTom Homan, the White House border czar, said about 700 federal agents would leave Minnesota, a large drop in agents on the ground but still leaving about 2,000 agents there, far above typical levels for the state.Homan said the reduction came as county jails were negotiating over increased coordination with federal officials, though it’s not clear which counties have agreed to coordinate with immigration enforcement officials. Continue reading...
items.content: Departure marks large drop in agents on the ground but still leaves about 2,000 there, far above typical levels for stateUS politics live – latest updatesTom Homan, the White House border czar, said about 700 federal agents would leave Minnesota, a large drop in agents on the ground but still leaving about 2,000 agents there, far above typical levels for the state.Homan said the reduction came as county jails were negotiating over increased coordination with federal officials, though it’s not clear which counties have agreed to coordinate with immigration enforcement officials. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump administration announces 'immediate' removal of 700 immigration officers from Minnesota
items.standfirst: Top US border official Tom Homan on Wednesday said the Trump administration is reducing the number of immigration enforcement officers in Minnesota by 700, "effective immediately". The deployment of some 3,000 federal security officers around Minnesota have drawn huge protests, particularly after the killings of residents Renée Good and Alex Pretti last month.
items.content: Top US border official Tom Homan on Wednesday said the Trump administration is reducing the number of immigration enforcement officers in Minnesota by 700, "effective immediately". The deployment of some 3,000 federal security officers around Minnesota have drawn huge protests, particularly after the killings of residents Renée Good and Alex Pretti last month.

items.content: Uber Technologies Inc. issued a mixed forecast and promoted an outspoken driverless-vehicle bull to be its new chief financial officer, signaling further investment in a closely watched area of the ride-hailing company’s business.

clusters.title: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of ex-Libyan leader, killed, say officials
clusters.neutral_headline: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of ex-Libyan leader, killed, say officials
bullet_summary: Gaddafi’s own office said he was killed in his home by masked assailants
Saif al Islam Gaddafi, the son of Libya's late dictator Muammar Gaddafi, has been shot dead by gunmen who broke into his home, officials have said

items.title: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of ex-Libyan leader, killed, say officials
items.standfirst: Dictator’s second son, a key figure in post-2011 Libyan politics, reportedly shot dead at home by masked assailantsSaif al-Islam Gaddafi, the son of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi and for years the second most powerful person in the country, has been killed in a village south-west of Tripoli, officials said on Tuesday night.The 53-year-old died from gunshot wounds in the town of Zintan, 85 miles south-west of the capital, according to the Libyan attorney general’s office. Gaddafi’s own office said he was killed in his home by masked assailants. Continue reading...
items.content: Dictator’s second son, a key figure in post-2011 Libyan politics, reportedly shot dead at home by masked assailantsSaif al-Islam Gaddafi, the son of the late Libyan dictator Muammar Gaddafi and for years the second most powerful person in the country, has been killed in a village south-west of Tripoli, officials said on Tuesday night.The 53-year-old died from gunshot wounds in the town of Zintan, 85 miles south-west of the capital, according to the Libyan attorney general’s office. Gaddafi’s own office said he was killed in his home by masked assailants. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Teen swims for hours to save family swept out to sea
clusters.neutral_headline: Teen swims for hours to save family swept out to sea
bullet_summary: Reported by NBC World, BBC World

items.title: Teen swims for hours to save family swept out to sea
items.standfirst: Austin Appelbee, a 13-year-old boy, swam 2.5 miles to rescue his mother and two younger siblings after their family was swept out to sea off the coast of Australia. NBC News’ Jesse Kirsch has the details on the heroic rescue.
items.content: Austin Appelbee, a 13-year-old boy, swam 2.5 miles to rescue his mother and two younger siblings after their family was swept out to sea off the coast of Australia. NBC News’ Jesse Kirsch has the details on the heroic rescue.

items.title: 'I was thinking about mum': Boy, 13, swims for hours to save family swept out to sea
items.standfirst: Austin Appelbee recounts his 'superhuman' swim which saved the lives of his mother and siblings in Australia.
items.content: Austin Appelbee recounts his 'superhuman' swim which saved the lives of his mother and siblings in Australia.
